txt.en:
'Why do you pester me with questions of what can be done? Nothing can be done!

'We had tracked Wormtongue's agent for some time, taking note of treachery where we found it. Our suspicions always seemed to point toward the traders from the Broadacres, Kingstead, and the Stonedeans. They know the roads, and knew where their stock would be - all the easier for them to guide the White Hand. I sent Egbalth to guard the crofters, but the wretch must have caught wind of his whereabouts....

'I know not why you persist in the absence of hope, but speak to Hildulf and the traders if you insist on trying to aid us. But remember, [placeholder], you know the risks....'
'Welcome back, [placeholder]. Here to buy or... ah, you're sorting out the Thane's affairs again, are you not? \n\n'Very well, I'll get you one of these days!'

Hildulf can be found to the south of the Mead Hall of Middlemead.\n\nYou have taken up Mágla's burden to rout the agent of Wormtongue in Middlemead. You should speak to Hildulf and the traders of Middlemead.
With hope all but extinguished, Thane Mágla is reluctant to continue his fruitless war against the agent of Wormtongue in Middlemead.
